title: Emmerdale’s Natalie J Robb fractured her toe during awkward sex scene with Jurell Carter
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Turns out that having sex in a caravan like Moira (Natalie J Robb) and Nate (Jurell Carter) are doing in Emmerdale is even more dangerous than being caught by Cain Dingle (Jeff Hordley)!

Ahead of their explosive stunt episode as Cain discovers the truth about his wife’s affair with the hunky farmhand, Natalie J Robb revealed that she has actually broken bones during awkward sex scenes for the storyline.

Speaking to Christine Lampard on Lorraine, Natalie was joined by Jurell as they revealed that the mechanics of filming sex scenes were really unromantic – particularly in the caravan.

Advertisement

Advertisement

(Which is saying something considering some of their bonking spots included literal rolls in the hay.)

Jurell laughed: ‘[It was] very busy! And the caravan is so small as well, because I’m 6ft 3in, and the caravan’s tiny, and we’ve had to do loads of intimate scenes in there!’

I actually fractured my little pinky toe, in the caravan doing a love scene!’ Natalie then revealed. ‘It was all the somersaults.’

‘You soldiered on though!’ Jurell added.

Who knew having sex in a tiny caravan in front of a camera team wasn’t going to cause broken bones? (Picture: ITV)

Moira and Nate have been far from subtle about their illicit sexual relationship, being discovered by several residents of the village while keeping Cain somewhat out of the picture.

However, that all blew up last night when Cain cornered Pete Barton (Anthony Quinlan), accusing him of being the one having it away with his wife.

But Pete knew the truth, and being kidnapped, beaten and tied to a chair is enough to get anyone talking and he revealed the sordid truth about Moira’s extra-curricular activities away from work with Nate.

Could things turn lethal for Nate, Cain and Moira? (Picture: ITV)

Now it looks like Cain could turn killer for being betrayed by Moira and Nate – and the trailer proves that things get explosive as he corners the couple on a boat.

‘We were both definitely out of our comfort zones doing some of these things,’ Natalie said. ‘As the week goes on, without revealing too much, there are some water stunts and things like that. It was a bit out of my depth.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

If she thought she was bad though, it was definitely a shock to Jurell, who until filming the show, didn’t know how to swim.

More: Natalie J Robb 25 soap spoilers: Coronation Street and EastEnders deaths, and Emmerdale explosion Shock death, Robron ending and 8 more Emmerdale spoilers Emmerdale spoilers: Nate sets out to destroy Cain

‘Before the storyline came about I spoke to Jeff, who spoke to Nala, our production manager, and he mentioned the swimming stunt, and I said to him “I can’t swim!”

‘I think there was a massive panic but it was just the nudge I needed, so I took swimming lessons with my swimming instructor Dominic who learned me to swim. So I can now swim!’

With truths set to come to light, what comes next for the troubled trio?
